website_summaries.verdict: A basic tree that has few extras but gets the job done.
pros: Helps save room in small rooms or dwellings
cons: Over-tightening the nuts can cause the support legs to bend

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned that this stand wouldn't have enough pegs for my weights but I was able to fit them all comfortably. In the picture I have 35 lb plates on the right with 5 lb plates above them, and 25 lbs plates on the left with 10 lb plates above those. On the bottom peg my 2.5 lb plates fit easily. I don't know if 45 lb or bigger would fit in combination others or might be too big. The whole thing took about 10 minutes to assemble using the included Allen wrench plus one of my own wrenches, and it seems sturdy and stable. Overall I'm pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ian W.

customer_reviews.title: Great space saver, and very stable.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, and great for those home gyms that don't have a lot of weights. I live in an apartment, so I needed something to save space. Couldn't be more pleased. Had it for a few months now and no bowing, loosening of the hardware, and no issues with stability. Would absolutely recommend. (Photo attached.) I took the photo from farther away to help show compactness of it. Takes up hardly any room, but plenty of room to add more weights down the road.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Chenevich

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Please keep in mind this is for 1" plates, seen a few negative reviews that it doesn't hold "xyz". If you're using this for 1" plates which are commonly used for dumbells or home starter kits then it works great. I was able to fit all 35 of my plates on it, the largest I have in 1" are 25 lbs and the 10 lbs weights fit above those. I had to put the 2.5 lbs weights in the bottom middle because it's a tighter fit than the other four posts. Feels sturdy once assembled.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Overall nice product.
customer_reviews.text: Nice product . I put about 200 lbs on it and it seems to be standing up prerty well, however, I put t2X25 lb plates in the middile at the bottom and that made it sag a little. Aseembly was barely 10 min, just four nuts and bolts that you need to tighten, Be cautious not to over tighten the nuts as that will bend into the suport legs. Overall satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Devinder Singh

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the price for any beginner.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this rack for about 6 months now and I'm quite impressed with it. It has held up to daily use (5 days a week) for the past few months with no issues what-so-ever, not even a chip of the powder coating. I keep 275 lbs (124 kg) of plates on it (50x2, 25x4, 10x4, 5x4 and 2.5x6) and it doesn't wiggle, move, bend or bow at all. Definitely worth the price for any beginner. Edit: I wanted to mention that I used threadlocker on the screws to make sure it stays together.
customer_reviews.author: Soledad

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed to store my plates. Others ...
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to store my plates. Others have said their olympic plates didn't fit on it, but I've actually been able to store my plates on it with no problem, other than my 45s. Sorry for the tiny picture but should give an idea.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: can be lifted easily by soft connection strap on top join even when ...
customer_reviews.text: can be lifted easily by soft connection strap on top join even when fully loaded. Spanner base bar sits almost half an inch below the feet of the legs, a few folds of cardboard box underneath the feet seems to redistribute the weight nicely. This is common, as both of these I have do this. Goes great on 3/4" plywood base and casters. loading pins will flex/bend when overloaded, make sure to heavy torque their bolts so the pin seats square/flush with sheet metal. 50lb plate will block anything over 12.5lb plates from being loading adjacently. (7) 10lb plates per pin. Vertical pin is cumbersome, would not install.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for small space home gyms.
customer_reviews.text: - Excellent value for $ - less than 5 mins to assemble - steady & stable - compact (perfect for small gym homes) I just received it so cannot comment about durability but I suspect the paint job might wear off eventually as it doesn’t seem like a thick coat was applied but for the price point I don’t mind buying a spray can and redo the paint as and when that happens.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Keeping them off the floor and all around...
customer_reviews.text: I use three different one inch bars and this rack helps organize their weight changes so I can move through my routine a little faster and easier. Its steady, holders are sized for clean removal and replacement of plates. And for me, it holds a sufficient number of plates for my workouts. I'm not a body builder, power lifter, or young anymore, but for someone who tries to to exercise regularly using free weights, it is ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Ian D. MacKinnon

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Stable
customer_reviews.text: Using now and happy so far with performance. I bought this one so it could hold both Olympic and standard weights and it is working well. I do recommend this rack, but I would have rated it a full 5 stars if the dimensions allowed for Olympic 45 lb weights to hang and rest FLAT by themselves. It does hold 45 lb weights if my pair of 25 or 35 lb weights are racked ahead of them on the same peg, but Ideally the rack could have been designed to correct this dimensional issue. Overall, solid construction, nice durable finish and easy to assemble. Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Came with a defect
customer_reviews.text: *UPDATED 5/22/19* I bought this same product about 3 years ago. It was a much better piece of equipment, then. Even that one was really cheaply made -- and that's what CAP is about and i'm ok with that. But this thing is awful. The bolts barely fit into the threaded pegs on 3/5 of the arms, and one wouldn't fit at all (threads on the peg are defective). Reached out to customer service for a replacement - it took them 5 weeks to respond and send new parts. *Adjusted rating to 2 stars to reflect the fact that they did eventually make it right. Still an awful product, would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: ZL

customer_reviews.title: Does what was expected
customer_reviews.text: Home garage “gym”. Product has multiple stacking options/locations. When moving weight off and on the upper stack bars do “wobble” a bit, but not like it is going to fall or collapse, just has some give to it. Honestly not certain what recommended max cap is, but I have about 360 lbs. distributed on it without issues. 5’s and 10’s on tops, 25’s on bottom, 2 1/2’s and tens on center top and bottom. Not sure I would consider much more weight, but for up to 350 lbs., easy assemble, compact, I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: PED

customer_reviews.title: Simple, easy setup, quite sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help organize the various weight plates I had lying on my garage gym floor. It is very easy to put together, and holds all of my weights from 25lb plates to 5lbs plates. It isn't the sturdiest, as the parts are hollow, but as long as you're not dragging it across the floor while it's full of weights, or otherwise torquing the bars, it should hold up indefinitely.
customer_reviews.author: BasinBictory

customer_reviews.title: Low quality; useless.
customer_reviews.text: What a racket. When it arrived, the box was torn all to hell so I had low expectations. After taking everything out, I was glad and semi-surprised to see no parts were broken or missing, but that was the only good thing about this package. I had to bend the first “base foot” to align with the holes, but whatever. It worked, and so I moved on to the other foot. As shown in the picture, it didn’t take me long to realize the holes on that would never line up no matter how much bending I did. Completely useless piece of metal. Go with a different manufacturer for this piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Big Momma

customer_reviews.title: Easy and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: This weight tree is great! I don't have too many plates, but I ended up using it for my two-inch plates, in addition to a few one-inch plates, and it works great for both. It keeps things out of the way, it's the perfect size, and it feels really sturdy. My 45lb pates dont fit because they have a pretty wide diameter, but I had no problems with any of the other plates. I use the center holder for 5s, since those fit well there. Good product and good price
customer_reviews.author: Jane M

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I expected, but it works!
customer_reviews.text: This was pretty easy to assemble, though there was a lot of metal shaving/beads inside the frame (from the holes that are drilled for the pegs). It’s pretty short and has a limited capacity, but it mostly works for what we need. We do keep our 45s on the bar at the squat rack. Our plates are technically Olympic size (2” hole) so there’s wiggle room on the pegs, but they hold just fine! (18” jump box for size reference) I don’t think you could fit a full set of rubberized plates on it because the pegs are kind of short.
customer_reviews.author: cavemen

customer_reviews.title: Ok bit good price if that is bigfest concern this will get the job done
customer_reviews.text: For the price ok but I have anoher one that doesnt wobble. Also the ones in gyms are generally much sturdier. This one is a bit flimsy and wobbles. All joints are welded. for 20 more I'd get something sturdier. It is just ok. Assembly cant ne easier not too sure why there are complaints there. Four bolts four nuts and four washers not going to get much easier than that.
customer_reviews.author: s

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, nice and compact, fits in the corner of my living room
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars because it would be much sturdier if the pegs were welded on, but I understand that would make shipping as well as the overall expense a bit higher. The thing works fine though, and I have 200# on it.
customer_reviews.author: Seller_CM

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, unbelievable price
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the price fool you... these are excellent quality racks at a great bargain. We have 2 sets of them and they are completely filled. We have several 45# plates on each and I'm not at all concerned that they'll fall and crush the children! Easy to assemble, they're exactly like the racks at the gym. One on each side of our power rack at home... easy!
customer_reviews.author: Megonotron

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a home gym
customer_reviews.text: was a little concerned about quality when i first bought it. I was thinking that for the price it couldn't be great, but after many months, the rack is holding up like a champ and has no problem keeping the 200lbs of weights I have on it. Granted, I keep the heavy stuff on the bottom and the lighter stuff on the top. My one comment is that the plate holder in the middle by the base has too little space for the heavy plates. You can only fit a 25lbs plate and that might be tough.
customer_reviews.author: SilentBob890

customer_reviews.title: Warehouse spill shipped with product
customer_reviews.text: I would love to say this rack is great, but the inside of this box was covered in spilled paint. The paint was still wet and dripping out of the box. It was clearly recognized by the shipper, as they places a large label over the corner to try to keep it from leaking. When I tried to address with the seller, I was directed to the manufacturer to request replacement parts.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts
customer_reviews.text: This product came with half the parts missing and none of the hardware. I have contacted the company twice. Lets see what happens. I will update you on whether the company is trustworthy.
customer_reviews.author: K&K

customer_reviews.title: This is great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is great for the price. I put 300+ lbs on it and had to move it from one side of the garage to the other (I put it on a plastic mat to slide it), and it didn't fall apart. The two "feet" on it did turn inward and outward while moving it, but were not in danger of breaking off. It is slightly wobbly when taking weights off the top section, but it doesn't look like it lacks structural integrity or is going to fall apart. All of the screws are very tight, so it seems the slight wobbliness and looseness is just part of the build.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Manhatten

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this purchase. I currently have about 300 pounds on this rack, and there is still plenty of room for more. It was very fast and easy to assemble. This is definitely a great product for a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Alison Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: I saw the other reviews about quality concerns and decided to order it anyway to my detriment. I just received it yesterday and a weld on one side of the base has already failed. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Needs better quality control
customer_reviews.text: I think this product will eventually work well, but one of the bars has a more deeply recessed hole for the threading than the others, and as a result, the provided bolt is too short. So now this annoyingly means a trip to the hardware store. Product needs better quality control.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Lacking Quality control
customer_reviews.text: Quality control is lacking. A few pieces that were welded were not squared up causing the rack to wobble around and I’m not talking a little off but they were massively off and no reason to miss this even during the final stage of powder coating process and boxing. Unfortunately it looks as if someone was not doing their job before sending it out.
customer_reviews.author: JPage

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly poor incorrect shipping and poor resolution
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the correct item (qty 2) 1 inch posts for 1 inch standard plates. I received 2 bulky boxes with the Olympic 2" posts. Their internal invoice even listed 2 inch not 1 inch. Now I've spent over 3 hours returning 2 items that were correctly ordered incorrectly shipped. The product looks good enough in construction but dealing with the the company has been beyond frustrating! I'd never oder from this company again!
customer_reviews.author: Richard K W

customer_reviews.title: Easy Installation
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install, 4 bolts and your done would only take about 5 minutes. I would have given it a 5 star but the configuration on the side with 3 holders cannot hold a 25, 10, 5 or even a 2.5 using the 25lb plate at the bottom. The other side fits a 35 and 45 no problem. The center inner part can fit a 5 and lower inner 10. Just seems like there should have been slightly more room on the side with the 3 holders. Other than that glitch seems sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnyonthespot

customer_reviews.title: Plate holder.
customer_reviews.text: This thing holds weights. If it's a bit unlevel when you put it together just put weights on it and it'll get sorted. Otherwise, easy setup, not too expensive, good design. Cap stuff isn't super high quality, but it gets the job done. I have the one for Oly plates too, use this to store the dumbell plates. Happy with both.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter L.

customer_reviews.title: I truly like this plate rack
customer_reviews.text: I truly like this plate rack. Before I had my barbell plates on the floor of my home gym. Now they are organized in one place and this makes it faster to change out during a workout. The rack assembles in about 10-15 minutes and requires no additional tools. After constructed it is sturdy and appears robust. The only thing I would caution anyone buying this or any other plate rack is to strongly consider it placement in your gym. A poor location will increase time between sets.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product, the only reason it lost a star was because the bars on the left side are a little too close together and the weight stack isn't in the right order because of where they can fit. Otherwise it's nice and strong and compact. Keeps our home gym neat and tidy
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Good, but assembly could be easier
customer_reviews.text: I ended up getting this rack because I was tired of knocking over (onto hardwood floors - imagine the noise my downstairs neighbors had to endure) and/or stubbing a toe on my plates I had just laying all over. Once assembled, this baby is solid and works. My only issue? I found the four screws a bit tedious to actually screw because there's no way to grip the other end while you screw the tops tighter because they're rounded and flat. I was able to screw them in place with an adjustable wrench, but this was a discovery I did all on my own and was literally my last resort that happened to work.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Product seems okay but Customer Service Lacking
customer_reviews.text: As another reviewer also mentioned, my plate rack was also missing all of the assembly parts to put it together. I have emailed the customer service contact now five times trying to get confirmation of anything. Two separate times, i have received a reply saying they will respond within 72 hours, but the time passes and no response. It only took two days to ship it to me, so I'm thinking it may be simpler to return it and just order a new one. The plate rack seems that it will be useful and seems to be well built, if only I can assemble it!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this plate rack from CAP Barbell, it was easy to assemble and is really sturdy! I placed 80lbs on one of the top holders and it didn't even move (I couldn't do more than 80lbs as no more plates could fit on the holder). But as another benefit, it looks really good wherever I placed it. Highly recommend it to anyone looking for a plate rack (or tree, as some may call it)
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Gets the big weights off the floor and out of the way
customer_reviews.text: Not completely stable but after a few times you can work around it. Also, I am not clear on its load specifications. Rather than total load, I would like to know what each peg will take. But it's a real solution in a tight gym.
customer_reviews.author: Alan S. Mathias

customer_reviews.title: Not safe
customer_reviews.text: this product look great but I will highly doubt that you can get up to 500 lbs of weight on it. I put less than 300 lb on it and the thing wobble like if it was made out of cheap plastic. if you have a couple of weights then yes go ahead, but if you want to load it then get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar D Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: Good enough to hold the weights.Small and cheap, but that's what you are paying for. If you are looking for a really high quality stable piece, you need to buy something else. The middle post on mine is already coming loose, for instance, but to tighten it, I'd have to empty the tree. I'm too lazy, so I just carefully load/unload that post.
customer_reviews.author: Vyasa

customer_reviews.title: Great rack
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great, compact solution for holding my weight plates. I use two interchangeable dumbbell bars, and with the plates and the rack, it all takes up about 20'' by 15'' of floor space. The rack has help up without trouble for several years now.
customer_reviews.author: J. James

customer_reviews.title: The perfect weight stand
customer_reviews.text: This organize weight stand is excellent. It works for what he was made. It holds the differents types weight in perfectly no matter where you put them. I like it a lot. Plus one thing that is important for me don't take to much space in the area. The paint is bright and rubber to avoid damage to the floor are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Efrain Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy unless it’s for change plates
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this plate tree unless you are only planning to use it for change plates. You cannot place any size of plates on the top peg if you have anything larger than a 25 pound non-bumper plate on the bottom pegs. Materials are so lightweight that the pegs were bent when I took it apart to return, from holding change plates not exceeding 20 pounds total jon any peg, at anytime.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for simple weights
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for simple weights at home ; weights of like 5lbs - 10lbs/20lbs. I don’t know about the bigger plates , but it’s great for the circumference of those plates. Simple and a better alternative rather than having them lay randomly on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: L.Delgado

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty!
customer_reviews.text: Nice weight tree, well constructed with a nice black finish. It is smaller than I expected but it holds plenty of weight. Have to be thoughtful about where the plates go to avoid plates on the same side overlapping.
customer_reviews.author: Unbiased opinion from a DYI’er

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great product for price! Our bumper plates have to kind of lay on top of each other due to size of the plates in retrospect to the stand, but this stand would be perfect for smaller plates ranging from 2.5-12 pounds as opposed to larger ones. Worth the price!!
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Great frame  for the price. Serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.text: Great frame for the price. Serves its purpose. Easy to install took maybe 5 minutes, supports the amount of weight it claims to support and maintains its stability.
customer_reviews.author: sokk

customer_reviews.title: Space Saving
customer_reviews.text: So far this product has worked very well for us. It was important that it was only a 1-inch plate rack because the plates we own are about 1 1/16" and it is very well balanced. So far it is holding up well. It is on carpet so I can't comment on the stand itself against the flooring. I would recommend, if you need to clear space from all the free weights.
customer_reviews.author: Sam B

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it’s supposed to
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It’s sturdy, and holds a lot of weight. Cons: The posts are closer than I’d like. When putting 45lb plates on one side there is barely enough room to put even the 2.5lbs on. It’s easily scratched from metal plates
customer_reviews.author: N. L.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and seems sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble. I got it put together in about 5 min. It holds my smaller weights well. Seems pretty sturdy, but I'm only using it to hold my 2.5s, 5s, 10s, and 25s. Great for keeping your smaller weights out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Elyse

customer_reviews.title: Fits everything I need
customer_reviews.text: Wow! In the picture I have 8-5 lbs, 4-7.5 lbs, 8-10 lbs and 4-2.5 lbs plates. It fits everything I will ever need for years to come. Easy to assemble. Just please don't use Use this for Olympic weights guys! I saw some one post a picture using for such and ... Facepalm. This is for medium and small 1 inch plates.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Good value and serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item for my traditional 1" plates. Overall the product has shown no issues and it took about 5 minutes to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's meant for and looks nice in my home gym.
customer_reviews.text: I give it a 4 star rating because they're so easy to put together and they hold my weights perfectly. I've purchased two of these, one online, and one in a store. Both of them were slightly wobbly on my cement floor (the legs weren't perfectly flat) and that's the only real reason I'm not giving them 5 stars. Otherwise, I'm perfectly happy with the purchase and would probably buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Shakey
customer_reviews.text: It holds the weights like it is supposed to but it is wobbly. The bottom doesn’t seem aligned. I think the parts were defected? Not sure but I don’t feel safe that it is wobbly because I have a toddler at home.
customer_reviews.author: Dkay

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for weight storage
customer_reviews.text: This took a few minutes for my three year old and me to put together. The set was missing a washer, but that was no big deal. Now the weights are neatly stacked and we have some much needed floor space.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gleason

customer_reviews.title: Great addition
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for my home gym. Held over 30 various weight plates. Built very well! What a difference it made! 👍🏽👍🏽👍🏽
customer_reviews.author: John L Boyd Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great for limited spaced areas
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for small spaces. Was a little nerve racking to put together because all pieces didn’t fit properly but I made it work.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: This is a useless product
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't firmly attach the tree to the base because the nuts doesn't screw in all the way. Now the whole thing wobbles back and forth... not exactly safe when you're trying to store plates. Should've included more washers or something because the screws are too long. Either way they're not even trying to deliver a good product. The box came beat up so I can't even return it. 10/10 Wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Hassan Nicola

customer_reviews.title: Great rack for for vinyl plates
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered thefor all of my Les Mills Body PUMP plates but was a bit discouraged to find out that the larger 25 pound plates wouldn't fit. This rack was actually my original choice so I ordered it. All the plates fit on the rack with ease and there is still space for more. There seems to be a little wobbling issue (not even that much to take note of) but that could possibly be because I screwed the nuts in a bit too tightly. It was a sinch to put together and I had it up in minutes. I'm very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jai Holla

customer_reviews.title: Strong, Well-Built, Functional
customer_reviews.text: I really like this stand. It’s well built and very functional in holding my weight plates. Certainly cleaned up the floor from having plates lying around every where. Exactly what I wanted and it doesn’t take up much room.
customer_reviews.author: 04rk88

customer_reviews.title: May have to buy the correct nuts/bolts
customer_reviews.text: It's built reasonably well. As some have mentioned, when you tighten the nuts, the metal actually caves in a little. The the nuts that were supplied didn't actually fit the bolts, so I had to go to Walmart and buy an equivalent set that fit, which was annoying. Once together, everything was fine. It holds the weights like it should. For the price, it's good.
customer_reviews.author: AVG

customer_reviews.title: Great but what the heck...
customer_reviews.text: Product is great but what the heck.... I did not get what I ordered... Bonus is I get a bar holder with this one but there's only 4 plate holders not five.
customer_reviews.author: chuckles

customer_reviews.title: This has worked well, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This has worked well, easy to assemble. It's so great to get all the plates off of the floor. All the screws, parts were present, which everyone would expect.
customer_reviews.author: J. WOODMAN

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be ok and will do the job. Gave 4 stars because it came with scratches, rough edges and missing 1 washer. Was hoping it would be a little bigger to handle bigger plates, but will do.
customer_reviews.author: Lioness

customer_reviews.title: Not designed for 45lb weights.
customer_reviews.text: If you plan on putting 45s on it then you will not be able to put anything else on the same side without the weights being in the way of each other, basically it's not designed to seat 45s. I put 5s on the same side because they're in the way the least, but the 25s and 35s have to be on the same side for the weights to fit the best without getting in the way of each other the most and it's really annoying because the 25s are just sitting on the 35s.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great organizer!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! My son now has somewhere to put away his weights as opposed to stepping over them in his room. This also means that I don't run into them and stub my toe! Now to get him a weight bench!
customer_reviews.author: onthego

customer_reviews.title: It's not heavy duty like you see at the gym
customer_reviews.text: Fair price for a decent weight tree. It's not heavy duty like you see at the gym, but it gets the job done. I'm using Olympic weights so I needed to arrange the weights so they fit without touching. 2 Prong side - 25lbs (top), 45lbs (bottom) 3 Prong side - 2.5lbs (top), 5lbs (middle), 10lbs (bottom) Trash the 35lb weights (nobody uses 35lbs anymore). I have CAP weights that fit perfectly on the vertical center prongs.
customer_reviews.author: lance chrisman

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase, good quality!
customer_reviews.text: Product delivered exactly as expected. All pieces were there and assembly was easy. The only thing I needed which wasn’t provided was a socket wrench to make tightening the bolts easier. I loaded the stand with 95 pounds of plates so not near the stated capacity, but it stands securely. I have only had it for a day, but so far, pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mom4

customer_reviews.title: Nice little Rack
customer_reviews.text: Very small awesome for dumb bell plates I havent tried it with any plate higher than some 25lbs
customer_reviews.author: Joey.ro20

customer_reviews.title: Liking it so far
customer_reviews.text: It arrived faster than expected and was pretty easy to assemble considering it didn’t come with any instructions. Even though this is meant for standard size plates it fits my Olympic plates just fine, no complaints here
customer_reviews.author: Nichelle P

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Screws in support legs wont stay tight. Legs continually move whenever u move the tree. Annoying AF.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: Depending on the size plates you are looking to store, you may want a different weight tree. I couldn’t store 25s and 10s on the same side if assembled perfectly according to the provided instructions. There is a work around by shifting the top arms up a hole that allows for plenty of storage space for stacking plates.
customer_reviews.author: B. Portman

customer_reviews.title: Wt stack
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be working ok. Not sure how much wt it can handle. I have 2 (50lb) plates on each bottom rack. Seems to be ok
customer_reviews.author: Rob Clary

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Product was badly bent upon arrival. The box it came in was fine but the actual tree is awkwardly warped. Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith Berry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for a smaller room!
customer_reviews.text: Very study an like the size in my small home gym. Holds one inch weights very well!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I loves this weight tree enough that I bought 2 over the years. Keeps the gym tidy and keeps the plates off the floor.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I thought
customer_reviews.text: It's sturdy but honestly the picture is a little misleading. I'm able to fit a 5 lb on the top bar and a 35 lb on the bottom. The 45 lb plate is too long for the bottom bar in a way that the perpendicular legs at the bottom get in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Jae Yun Lee

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly fine
customer_reviews.text: Had all the parts and was a breeze to assemble. I put weights on it and it's doing it's job. Paint seems like it won't last but overall perfectly fine for the 36 I paid.
customer_reviews.author: PuckOff

customer_reviews.title: Perfect !
customer_reviews.text: 5/5 for sure ! ! I was initially hesitant about this because of the other reviews but I think that it is safe to say that this was actually a great buy ! Solid construction so I don't have to worry about all of the weight that I have rested on it ! Only thing is that make sure you have it wherever you want it because well its a bit heavy to move once its loaded lol ! Also I was quite surprised when this came a few days earlier than expected ! I highly recommend this to anyone looking at it !
customer_reviews.author: Positive_Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Product was fine and at the right price but shipped incomplete
customer_reviews.text: They shipped it without one of the feet. Going to just use a 2x4 and bolt that to the stand so it has a base but trying to deal with CAP's customer support is bollocks. I called five times over a period of two weeks, left voicemails, and sent e-mails to no avail. Never talked to a person...no one ever called me back.
customer_reviews.author: E. Kane

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: GREAT PIECE FOR YOUR 1" PLATES. ASSEMBLY IS QUICK, VERY STURDY........U.S.M.C. .
customer_reviews.author: U.S.M.C.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me.
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised that I could find a weight rack this sturdy at this price. I have about 300 lbs. on it and have no trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Walz

customer_reviews.title: Great for home gyms
customer_reviews.text: Product is a good value for the money. Maybe not as nice as some commercial weight racks, but should be sufficient for most home gyms.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Carter

customer_reviews.title: Great plate rack
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great space saver for my plates. Really put together well and not large so helps keep plates stored in the garage off the floor. Easy to put together and holds a decent amount of plates.
customer_reviews.author: McLovin

customer_reviews.title: Nice rack for weights
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice rack. They hold the 1 inch weights fine.
customer_reviews.author: Whoever

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This works great for the small number of plates I have. I may have to upgrade in the future. But for now it's perfect. It keeps my weights nicely organised. If I need more room in the future I may just buy another one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn Oscura

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Happy with this purchase and how it’s helped keep my weights organized. Does exactly what it should
customer_reviews.author: Courtney S.

customer_reviews.title: Good Weight Rack
customer_reviews.text: There is a little bit of wobble down the bottom, and I had to retighten the bolts holding the stabilizers/bottom pieces to the top, but overall it works great. With some weights put on the arms, the wobble goes away completely. It feels sturdy and the metal is very smooth, so I have no worries about it lasting a while now that it is put together tightly and assembled in the corner of my room.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Bassett

customer_reviews.title: CAP makes the best stuff. Racks 6 10# grip plates per arm
customer_reviews.text: CAP makes the best stuff. Racks 6 10# grip plates per arm, or 7 of the solid CAP 10# plates per arm (standard plates w/ 1" hole). Does NOT come with rubber feet, but I use it on carpet.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: sturdiness and stability.
customer_reviews.text: as above mentioned. easy to assemble, stability and sturdiness. Satisfied. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Nestor Torres

customer_reviews.title: Cheap for a reason
customer_reviews.text: Missing most of the nuts and bolts and the ones I did get are so cheap the heads stripped putting it together. And be careful when you open the box as there was a lot of beads from the powder coat that fall everywhere. I was able to get replacement parts from the manufacturer and the tree does it’s job.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: I'm so satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: My son wanted me to order this for him to keep weights on, and it works great for him. He absolutely loves it! So do I as keeps weights organized and not all over the place. Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Stupid mistakes...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. But they put the strength sticker upside down. There was a huge dent in the other piece. And end caps were too small. So disappointed that I have to look at this everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy little rack. I use it mostly for 5lb and 10lb weights, to be fair, but I have all the branches fully loaded up with those, probably ~200lb between the 5 spots, and no problems.
customer_reviews.author: mduck

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and provides plenty of room to store the weights I'm currently using.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Trofe

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to read description...
customer_reviews.text: Only giving 4 stars as the prongs were smaller than our weights. The prongs are slimmer than Olympic size weights. May have been an error on my part when ordering. But very sturdy and easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: My3Bs

customer_reviews.title: good value plate rack
customer_reviews.text: A little annoying to assemble without a socket wrench. If you have a socket wrench, assembly would take five minutes. Lots of space. Currently using it for a 300lb set of olympic plates (45s, 35s, 25s, 10s, 5s, 2.5s) and a set of adjustable dumbell plates as well. Keeps things organized. Less floor area than other models.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Martin

customer_reviews.title: Not what i expected
customer_reviews.text: I give it 4 stars because what I know now. I would have bought a different one. It does the job however. The pegs are way too close to each other. When you put a 45 plate it's too big and touches the above plate etc. Other then that it it what it says it is.
customer_reviews.author: specter

customer_reviews.title: 45lb plates dont seem to fit
customer_reviews.text: Great for weights .... seems sturdy so far. The only issue I see is that it will not let you put 45lbs weights on the bottom. It's just sits to low. Over all though, it works well
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Curran

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok. Wouldn’t buy again at this price
customer_reviews.text: It serves it purpose but at $45 it’s way over priced for a few pieces of hollow metal frame.
customer_reviews.author: Paula M Seritti

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived when it said it would. Instructions were very easy, all you need is a wrench. I put it together in less than ten minutes! Once you have it securely tightened, it is pretty sturdy. No damaged or missing parts. :) I'm still waiting on my plate weights to arrive, so I'll update pictures if I can when they do!
customer_reviews.author: Sparkleypancakes

customer_reviews.title: Came missing pieces. Replaced by CAP
customer_reviews.text: Received item missing all hardware to assemble. Contacted CAP and was told to fill out the online support form. Hardware was mailed and received.
customer_reviews.author: Jeramiah

product_meta.title: CAP Barbell Black/Red Tree Storage Rack for Weights and Bar
feature_bullets: Construction – Built with steel and finished with a black powder coat; rubber ends on the base help to protect floors from scratches and scuffs
Features – designed to hold standard weight plates with a 1-inch center hole; provides easy storage of weights; outer plate posts are 8-inches long; inner plate posts are 5-inches long
Space-saving design – The a-frame design of this rack allows weights of various sizes to fit; store heavier weights on the bottom outer posts and lighter weights on the top for stability
Specs – Assembled dimensions are 22. 5” length x 18” wide x 37” tall; rack weighs 19-pounds; 500-pound weight capacity; 30-day Manufacturer ; Assembly required

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
